steps.title: GG stands for “good game.”
steps.content: GG stands for “good game.” In professional sports leagues, many teams line up at the end of a match to shake hands and politely acknowledge their opponents. In the world of video games, sending GG is essentially the equivalent of this—you’re letting your opponents know that you enjoyed the match, all while acknowledging the final result of the game. GG is often sent on its own without anything else added to the message. GG is commonly used in online multiplayer gaming communities, like League of Legends , Rocket League , Roblox , Fortnite , and so on.

steps.title: Send GG at the end of a game to be a good sport.
steps.content: Send GG at the end of a game to be a good sport. While you’re not obligated to send GG, it’s a polite way to acknowledge the results of the game. You might even notice some of your teammates joining in and sending the message as well.

steps.title: Send GG after poor gameplay or a bad fight to be sarcastic.
steps.content: Send GG after poor gameplay or a bad fight to be sarcastic. In some instances, people have sent GG in a disparaging way to comment on a poorly played part of the game, like a bad team fight. Using GG in this way is pretty unsportsmanlike and won’t score you any points or credibility with your teammates. For instance, you might send a salty GG while playing a round of “Murder Mystery 2” in Roblox when you’re eliminated from the game for being suspected as the killer.

steps.title: Reply with gg at the end of a game if your opponents send it.
steps.content: Reply with gg at the end of a game if your opponents send it. Everyone is welcome to send GG after a video game match. So, if you notice your opponents doing this sportsmanlike gesture, feel free to get in on the action. Opponent: GG wp You: gg!

steps.title: GG WP
steps.content: GG WP GG WP is short for “Good Game Well Played”—it’s basically an extension of GG that acknowledges how both teams played well. It’s a very sportsmanlike message to send at the end of a game. [1] X Research source

steps.title: GG no re
steps.content: GG no re GG no re is short for “Good Game No Rematch”—it’s typically sent after a brutal match-up where one team steamrolls the other, typically sent by the dominating party. [2] X Research source All in all, it’s a pretty toxic thing to send, and only adds insult to injury after a decisive victory.

steps.title: GG ez
steps.content: GG ez Similar to “GG no re,” GG ez is short for “Good Game Easy.” It’s typically sent by the victor as a way of taunting their opponent, as if saying “You were easy to beat” or “That was an easy game to win.” In some cases, the losing party might send GG ez to poke fun at the fact that they lost.

steps.title: GL HF
steps.content: GL HF GL HF (sometimes written as GL & HF) stands for “Good Luck and Have Fun,” and is a friendly way to interact with your opponents at the beginning of a video game match-up. You: “GL HF!” Opponent: “Thanks, you too”

steps.title: .gg is a domain name extension used for video game-centric sites.
steps.content: .gg is a domain name extension used for video game-centric sites. Like .com or .edu, .gg is another type of domain name extension that goes at the end of a URL. Originally associated with islands in the English Channel (like Guernsey), the gaming community has since adopted .gg as a common website extension for video game companies and enthusiasts. [3] X Research source For example, op.gg is a League of Legends resource designed to help optimize player gameplay and setup, while fortnite.gg provides an interactive map of the Fortnite universe.
